intro: Eriachne yarrabensis, commonly known as the Yarrabent grass, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of central Australia. It belongs to the grass family Poaceae and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and narrow leaves. The plant produces small, spike-like inflorescences that bear tiny, spikelet-based flowers. It is adapted to survive in dry conditions, with mechanisms to conserve water and withstand high temperatures. Eriachne yarrabensis plays a role in stabilizing sandy soils and providing habitat for native wildlife.
